pkgmetadata.longdescription: DASH is a direct descendant of the NetBSD version of ash (the Almquist SHell). It is almost POSIX compliant; the most notable exception is the lack of multicharacter support. It has some optional POSIX extensions like e.g.: local variables, support for test -nt/-ot, echo -n

use.flag: Cripple XSI compliance of echo and simultaneously remove echo -n as forced by the ebuild in the main gentoo repository, see bug 590696. This differs from all other shells and breaks expectations of historical scripts like those generated by autoconf-2.13 but can perhaps be useful to check for POSIX-embedded-minimal usage
